I've searched the forums to no avail, and request your help as a last resort. I have an ATI Radeon X800 Pro. For some reason, X wont work. I tried "dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" then selecting the Vesa Driver, but that doesnt work either. Any suggestions please?
you followed the wiki page for ati?
then follow the wiki, and make sure you've installed the necessary packages
you need both linux-restricted-modules-$(uname -r) and xorg-driver-fglrx
apt-cache search linux-amd64, and look for an appropriate kernel meta-package (e.g. linux-amd64-generic, linux-amd64-k8)
those will depend on and pull in a matching linux-restricted-modules when you install them
or did you install a 32-bit version?
you got linux-amd64-generic or -k8 installed (along with linux-restricted-modules)?
